intro: Hoffmannia australis, commonly known as the Australian hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Hoffmannia australis typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to the dry climate of its native region.
